Note.Name: Range
Note.Parameters: Style = With Base, Chaos = 23.11%, Scale X = 0.8, Scale Y = 0.7
Note.Text: Range is used in the "With Base" style to create a vast mountain range. The custom Size in Advanced Settings gives us slightly longer, non-uniform shapes.

Note.Name: Wizard
Note.Parameters: Phase 1 = Craggy, Strength = High, Removal = High
Note.Text: Craggy erosion with high Removal and Strength consolidates the mountain range in to precise shapes and erodes the lowest area into flatness.

Note.Name: FractalTerraces
Note.Text: FractalTerraces add stratification and breakup the uniformity of the mountain range.

Note.Name: Anastomosis
Note.Parameters: Impact = 27.73%, Flow Width = 96.06%, Erosion Depth = 96.90%, Flow = Rivers x4
Note.Text: Anastomosis' strong Width and Depth help carve out wide channels into the landscape within the existing flow structure. Our terrain portion of the Fjord is now ready.

Note.Name: Sea
Note.Parameters: Level = 5.00%, Coastal Erosion = False, Shore Height = 11.21%
Note.Text: The Sea node adds the water body to our Fjord. Since we are dealing with a vast landscape, Coastal Erosion is ignored.
